alert.note: Alert for Parke; Vermillion; Vigo (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:57PM EST until February 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Petersburg. Wabash River at Clinton, Terre Haute, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Covington, Montezuma, and Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The river is rising at all locations downstream. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop, or may develop, on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, FEBRUARY 5... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Montezuma. * WHEN...Until Monday, February 5. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Park in southern Montezuma begins to flood. Higher bottomlands begin to flood. Water backs up most local tributaries. River water is at the top of some private levees. Lowest county roads begin to flood. Parke CR 75 W begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Sunday was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday, February 4. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EST /100 PM CST/.
